XMLDB.COMMENT: XMLDB file for user data management

TABLE.NAME: totara_userdata_purge_type
TABLE.COMMENT: List of available user data purge types

FIELD.NAME: userstatus
FIELD.COMMENT: Type is suitable for this user status only. Cannot be changed after creation, 0 means active, 1 deleted and 2 suspended

FIELD.NAME: fullname
FIELD.COMMENT: Human readable name, mutlilang supported

FIELD.NAME: idnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique plain text identifier

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: HTML text with description of purging type

FIELD.NAME: allowmanual
FIELD.COMMENT: Allow use for manual purging

FIELD.NAME: allowdeleted
FIELD.COMMENT: Allow selection for purging after deletion

FIELD.NAME: allowsuspended
FIELD.COMMENT: Allow selection for purging after suspension

FIELD.NAME: usercreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Who added this type

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: When was this type added

FIELD.NAME: timechanged
FIELD.COMMENT: Updated only when user indicates that purges should be reapplied.

TABLE.NAME: totara_userdata_purge_type_item
TABLE.COMMENT: Purge type items and their settings, each purge type has records for all items available at the time of saving changes

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: Plugin name or subsystem, e.g. mod_glossary, core_user

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Class name without namespace, e.g. comment, post, completion

FIELD.NAME: purgedata
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 means item skipped during purging, 1 means data to be purged

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: The time when item was added to the purge type, this might be interesting for newly introduced items in preexisting types.

FIELD.NAME: timechanged
FIELD.COMMENT: Last time when the purge field was changed

TABLE.NAME: totara_userdata_user
TABLE.COMMENT: Extension of user table for tracking of selected purging types for each user - 1 to 1 mapping to user table

FIELD.NAME: usercontextid
FIELD.COMMENT: User context id, we need the value here because user deletion removes user context record

FIELD.NAME: timesuspended
FIELD.COMMENT: Best guess when user was actually deleted

FIELD.NAME: timesuspendedpurged
FIELD.COMMENT: Last time the user was purged with the selected type, resets to null after type change

FIELD.NAME: timedeleted
FIELD.COMMENT: Best guess when user was actually suspended

FIELD.NAME: timedeletedpurged
FIELD.COMMENT: Last time the user was purged with the selected type, resets to null after type change

TABLE.NAME: totara_userdata_purge
TABLE.COMMENT: List of all user data purges and their result

FIELD.NAME: origin
FIELD.COMMENT: suspended, deleted or manual keyword matching totara_userdata_purge_type allowxxxx columns, use other keyword for custom code

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The target user

FIELD.NAME: usercontextid
FIELD.COMMENT: User context id, we need the value here because user deletion removes user context record

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: Context restriction will be used for resetting user data in one course or activity, null means the whole system

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: The time of creation of this purge, in case of manual purges this is the time when user requested the purge

FIELD.NAME: timestarted
FIELD.COMMENT: Start of purge process, this happens in scheduled task or ad-hoc task

FIELD.NAME: timefinished
FIELD.COMMENT: End of purge or time when marked as timed out

FIELD.NAME: result
FIELD.COMMENT: null means not finished, -1 completed ok, -2 means error, -3 means skipped, -4 cancelled, -5 timed out

TABLE.NAME: totara_userdata_purge_item
TABLE.COMMENT: Items of each user data purge and their result

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: Plugin name or subsystem, e.g. mod_glossary, core_user

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Class name without namespace, e.g. comment, post, completion

FIELD.NAME: timestarted
FIELD.COMMENT: Start time of purging method

FIELD.NAME: timefinished
FIELD.COMMENT: End time of purging method or time when marked as timed out

FIELD.NAME: result
FIELD.COMMENT: null means not finished, -1 completed ok, -2 means error, -3 means skipped, -4 cancelled, -5 timed out

TABLE.NAME: totara_userdata_export_type
TABLE.COMMENT: List of available user data export types

FIELD.NAME: fullname
FIELD.COMMENT: Human readable name, mutlilang supported

FIELD.NAME: idnumber
FIELD.COMMENT: Unique plain text identifier

FIELD.NAME: description
FIELD.COMMENT: HTML text with description of purging type

FIELD.NAME: allowself
FIELD.COMMENT: Allow selection for self export

FIELD.NAME: includefiledir
FIELD.COMMENT: Include file contents in export archive

FIELD.NAME: usercreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Who added this type

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: When was this type added

FIELD.NAME: timechanged
FIELD.COMMENT: Updated after very update

TABLE.NAME: totara_userdata_export_type_item
TABLE.COMMENT: Export type items and their settings, each export type has records for all items available at the time of saving changes

FIELD.NAME: component
FIELD.COMMENT: Plugin name or subsystem, e.g. mod_glossary, core_user

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Class name without namespace, e.g. comment, post, completion

FIELD.NAME: exportdata
FIELD.COMMENT: 0 means item skipped during export, 1 means data to be exported

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: The time when item was added to the export type, this might be interesting for newly introduced items in preexisting types.

FIELD.NAME: timechanged
FIELD.COMMENT: Last time when the export field was changed

TABLE.NAME: totara_userdata_export
TABLE.COMMENT: List of all user data exports and their result

FIELD.NAME: origin
FIELD.COMMENT: self keyword matching totara_userdata_purge_type allowxxxx columns, use other keyword for custom code

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: The target user

FIELD.NAME: contextid
FIELD.COMMENT: Context restriction will be used for exporting user data from one course or activity, null means the whole system

FIELD.NAME: usercreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Usually the user that request the export

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Time when user requested the export

FIELD.NAME: timestarted
FIELD.COMMENT: Start of export process, this happens in ad-hoc task

FIELD.NAME: timefinished
FIELD.COMMENT: End of export or time when marked as timed out, this is also used to export old files

FIELD.NAME: result
FIELD.COMMENT: null means not finished, -1 completed ok, -2 means error, -3 means skipped, -4 cancelled, -5 timed out

TABLE.NAME: totara_userdata_export_item
TABLE.COMMENT: Items of each user data export and their result

FIELD.NAME: timestarted
FIELD.COMMENT: Start time of purging method

FIELD.NAME: timefinished
FIELD.COMMENT: End time of purging method or time when marked as timed out

FIELD.NAME: result
FIELD.COMMENT: null means not finished, -1 completed ok, -2 means error, -3 means skipped, -4 cancelled, -5 timed out
